greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Odd numbers n such that n^2 is an abundant number.
comment: Submitted at the suggestion of T.D. Noe.
For any number k, the abundance of k^2 is an odd number.
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
mathematica: fQ[n_] := Block[{ds = DivisorSigma[1, n^2] - 2 n^2}, ds > 0 && OddQ@ ds]; Select[ Range[1, 5353, 2], fQ@# &]
program: (PARI) is(n)=n%2 && sigma(n^2,-1)>2 \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Feb 21 2017
results.author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Mar 30 2010
ext: Name corrected by _T. D. Noe_, Jul 09 2010
